product.categories_flat: Electronics > Computers & Accessories > Computers & Tablets > Laptops > Traditional Laptops
product.description: STUN RIVALS. STAY IN AWE. Alienware m18 Gaming Laptop Play like a boss with a high-powered, 18-inch gaming laptop that features advanced cooling, 14th Generation Intel Corei7 14700HX processor and NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4070 8GB GDDR6 graphics. A more comfortable palm rest. A redesigned hinge. And updated perimeter feet. Those are but a few of the improvements that help make our Legend 3 design more premium, tactile and futuristic than ever.

feature_bullets: COMMANDING POWER & PRESENCE: Outplay your rivals and show them who's boss with overclockable 14th Gen Intel Core i7 14700HX processor and NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4070 8GB GDDR6 graphics.
UNCOMPROMISED PERFORMANCE: Our cooling technology helps maintain system stability, even during the most demanding sessions.
FEAST YOUR EYES: Never overlook your competition with our crystal-clear, 18-inch, 16:10 display with Dolby Vision in 165Hz QHD Display.
SUPERCHARGE YOUR PLAY: Get immersed in the game with breathtaking, awe-inspiring visuals — made possible with NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4070 8GB GDDR6 graphics.
KEY INTO SUPERIOR GAMING: Amp up your comfort and precision with a recessed keyboard, full NumPadand a 14% larger touchpad.Based on Dell analysis comparing to m17 R5, November 2022

Dell Servcies: 1 Year Onsite Service provides support when and where you need it. Dell will come to your home, office, or location of choice, if an issue covered by Limited Hardware Warranty cannot be resolved remotely.

top_reviews.title: Best looking  and powefull laptop
top_reviews.body: In my opinion, the best looking laptop. You can really feel all the power of the 4080, it can run almost any triple A game. The cooling system is amazing also when you are gaming you can feel the coolness in the fan area. The screen quality could be better for the price, i.e. maybe an OLED or at least 240 refresh rate. Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
In my opinion, the best looking laptop. You can really feel all the power of the 4080, it can run almost any triple A game. The cooling system is amazing also when you are gaming you can feel the coolness in the fan area. The screen quality could be better for the price, i.e. maybe an OLED or at least 240 refresh rate.

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2025

top_reviews.title: Highly Under Rated Laptop!
top_reviews.body: I've tried just about every name brand laptop in this category (gaming laptops) and this was the only one (Alienware) that I did not try. The reason I didn't try was because of all the not-so-great reviews and how the cons were just simply not 'acceptable' for 2024. After much trial and tribulation, I figured I had nothing left to lose except to not try this brand. Well low and behold! This laptop was PERFECT for me! I wanted a portable AND capable Beast and this fit the bill PERFECTLY! It maybe a little chunky for people who don't eat meat or work out, but for me it was a very acceptable compromise for what I was looking for in a laptop (a consistent gaming experience whether at home or abroad). It plays all my games at max settings without any problems at all. Others I've had always ended up throttling themselves (despite being 'higher spec'd' than this one) and either stuttered or over-heated to the point it would lock up or shut down. This laptop might get a little 'loud' but it never over heats, never shuts down, and to my surprise, never throttled, not even once. I bought a laptop backpack for this laptop here in Amazon (just look up backpacks for 18.4" laptops). It works PERFECTLY for my needs. Tech Support is practically built right into this machine too. Most questions I had about anything was easily found with the included software packages. I have no regrets with this purchase and can easily recommend this to people who want a great laptop and a Beast without all the marketing and fluff (and failures) of the other 'Top Tier' or 'Higher Spec'd' laptops out there (looking at you ASUS and LENOVO). Oh wait, I do have one regret, and it's that I didn't get this sooner and let my own bias and the bias of other laptop 'Professional Reviewers' sway me away from this brand early on during my searches for the PERFECT laptop for ME. Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2024

top_reviews.title: PLEASE READ THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS BEFORE PURCHASE - I REGRET IT...
top_reviews.body: UPDATE- If I could give negative stars I would. After sending the device into customer service - no motherboard issue - instead they're claiming the LCD screen was cracked along with the palm rest and the back of laptop - consistent with a fall....ummm nope never dropped its super heavy and stays on a desk all day. Basically a scam - they want $350 to fix that stuff on a 6 month old laptop. I'm currently talking with customer service to see if someone DROPPED it upon after delivery - I cant possibly be responsible for damage during shipping as THEY PROVIDED SHIPPING LABEL and I'm assuming insurance. I regret purchasing the device and the customer service is HORRIBLE because NOTHING is wrong with the device they are making up issues to make money - AVOID AVOID AVOID AVOID....  READ THE REVIEWS - BELIEVE THE REPORTED ISSUES. I may have a motherboard issue after only a few months of use. I bought this laptop to play TWO games - both are web based and they worked perfectly for a while - then recently It stopped working on one of the games - and crashes IMMEDIATELY upon log in or shortly there after - I cant play the game on it at all. Ive updated game, cleared appdata, updated drivers, and even FACTORY RESET. NOT FIXED. Ive contacted the game - they cant find an issue on their end - I've contacted Microsoft - they cant find a problem - Ive contacted DELL they tried to help - I even paid the $99 for additional software support and after 3 hours they say I need to send it in bc its still w/in warranty. Im extremely disappointed because a friend TOLD ME NOT TO GET AN ALIENWARE LAPTOP but i didnt listen - hopefully sending it in fixes the issue or thats $3000 down the drain. Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2025

top_reviews.title: Finally have this thing rock n rollin!!!
top_reviews.body: I absolutely love this machine now...switched to 32gb of kingston fury impact ddr5 running at 6400 mt/s and it runs amazing. I have hyperthreading on. Everything is turned on and running stable. No more crashing on Diablo 4 fenris error...Even with DLSS and frame generation turned on. My first ever Intel machine and I love it despite the rocky start we got off to. Alienware has a great aesthetic and the build quality of their laptops are second to none. I just wish they could do better in the display department, 165hz is a bit slow for a system with a 4080, and the FHD 480hz resolution leaves a lot to be desired in the 18in model. I have the 360hz FHD display on my M15 R5 that has a 3070 gpu, and its great for the smaller screen, I would really like to have been able to get this one with a UHD 4k option, also sound card is lacking. Speakers are the exact same junk that they used on my smaller laptop, considering there are smaller form factor machines in this size that they have managed to stuff a subwoofer inside of, Alienware is still late to the party when it comes to gaming devices and I believe Dell being largely to blame as their niche has always been in the office segment. They really need to step it up in their display technology as well as audio delivery if they are ever going to be as nice as Razer and MSI laptops in my opinion. Granted, I would have had to spend another 1000 dollars to get a Razer Blade 18 with similar specs. Read more
top_reviews.body_html:

Alienware has a great aesthetic and the build quality of their laptops are second to none. I just wish they could do better in the display department, 165hz is a bit slow for a system with a 4080, and the FHD 480hz resolution leaves a lot to be desired in the 18in model. Speakers are the exact same junk that they used on my smaller laptop, considering there are smaller form factor machines in this size that they have managed to stuff a subwoofer inside of, Alienware is still late to the party when it comes to gaming devices and I believe Dell being largely to blame as their niche has always been in the office segment. They really need to step it up in their display technology as well as audio delivery if they are ever going to be as nice as Razer and MSI laptops in my opinion. Granted, I would have had to spend another 1000 dollars to get a Razer Blade 18 with similar specs.
Read more

date.raw: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2024

top_reviews.title: Great laptop marred by Alienware’s awful cooling solution.
top_reviews.body: Fantastic laptop, but Alienware’s cooling solution CANNOT keep this I9 from hitting temps a little too high. I’ve defaulted to “quiet” mode and lowered my CPU’s power by about 20% now it’s much better temp wise and as far as gaming goes 0 performance lost that I can tell Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
Fantastic laptop, but Alienware’s cooling solution CANNOT keep this I9 from hitting temps a little too high. I’ve defaulted to “quiet” mode and lowered my CPU’s power by about 20% now it’s much better temp wise and as far as gaming goes 0 performance lost that I can tell

top_reviews.title: It’s just great.
top_reviews.body: I bought this laptop for work and coding. It is fast and has a lot of memory enough to do multiple tasks at once. I also installed a couple of games and it had no problem running them. Read more

I bought this laptop for work and coding. It is fast and has a lot of memory enough to do multiple tasks at once. I also installed a couple of games and it had no problem running them.

top_reviews.title: High Quality but Disappointing
top_reviews.body: Over the past two months, this is the third laptop I’ve purchased, and unfortunately, they either had hardware issues or didn’t match the advertised specs.  My last two purchases were Asus ROG Strix Scar models, and I can confidently say that Alienware offers much better build quality, keyboard, and lighting. Additionally, the fan noise is noticeably smoother and quieter compared to the Asus ROG 18 and Asus ROG 17 X3D.  The only major issue with this laptop is the screen, which has a leak problem, and that was truly disappointing.  Aside from the screen issue and the heavy weight (which is understandable given the premium build quality), this is a well-built and high-quality laptop. Read more
top_reviews.body_html:
Over the past two months, this is the third laptop I’ve purchased, and unfortunately, they either had hardware issues or didn’t match the advertised specs.

My last two purchases were Asus ROG Strix Scar models, and I can confidently say that Alienware offers much better build quality, keyboard, and lighting. Additionally, the fan noise is noticeably smoother and quieter compared to the Asus ROG 18 and Asus ROG 17 X3D.

The only major issue with this laptop is the screen, which has a leak problem, and that was truly disappointing.

Aside from the screen issue and the heavy weight (which is understandable given the premium build quality), this is a well-built and high-quality laptop.
Read more
